message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

This paper is about relation extraction, which is a task in natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper proposes a novel model that uses graph convolutional networks and attention mechanisms, which are popular techniques in machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI), respectively. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely category. The model is designed to learn how to selectively attend to relevant sub-structures, which involves learning from data and optimizing a loss function, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible category. The paper also reports experiments on various tasks, including cross-sentence n-ary relation extraction and large-scale sentence-level relation extraction, which involve evaluating the performance of the model on large datasets, indicating that cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is a plausible category. Finally, the paper deals with the problem of selecting relevant information from dependency trees, which is related to information retrieval (IR), suggesting that cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is a possible category as well.
